heaviest_rainfall.status: The most intense rainfall recorded took place on 04 January 2025, with precipitation totalling 36.8mm.  The rain fell at 4.6mm per hour at times over the course of the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: A torrential downpour occurred on 02 September 2025 when the rain reached a maximum intensity of 27.0mm per hour.  This happened during a 15.0 hour storm when 21.19mm of rain fell.

longest_rain.status: The longest rain storm on record lasted 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm of rain fell and at one point was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning strikes in one day since 11 April 2025 is 23 and it happened on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: Currently no stormy weather.  The most recent storm happened on 21 September 2025 and it lasted for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is currently no cold snap.  This year there have been 6 cold snaps, usually there are 3.7 cold snaps per year.

extreme.status: The maximum temperature difference seen is 26.7°C, observed on 29 April 2025 when the temperature fell to 0.4°C but also managed to reach 27.1°C on the same day.

heatwaves.status: There is no heatwaves at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 heatwavess, with an average of 1.9 per year.

tropical.status: The previous tropical night was on 18 July 2025, with only 62 in total since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (188°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind gust recorded on 13 October 2012.

run.status: To date, the maximum wind run recorded is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: To date, the maximum wind speed recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 2.8°C) and outside temperature (up 2.8°C).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 784 m) and light levels (up 3547 lux) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 285.2m lower than yesterday, 783.7m lower than the past week, 449.0m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 929m to a maximum of 2240m, averaging 1259.9m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 2040m and 1708.9m respectively.
cloud levels.summary: Clouds will be high, allowing good sunlight.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; you can expect comfortable, mild temperatures. Also, humidity should not be a concern and little or no wind. A few light raindrops may fall, clouds will be high, allowing good sunlight, and a mix of sun and clouds. Weather patterns to stay the same.

washing.phrase: The conditions are favourable for drying your laundry outside right now but, as always, monitor the situation for changes to the weather.
